module.name: JsonIni
module.descr: This unit provides , a class that implements the ini file interface using JSON format instead of traditional ini files. It allows applications to store configuration data as JSON objects while maintaining compatibility with the standard TCustomIniFile interface.

element.name: TJSONIniFile
element.short: Ini file implementation using JSON storage format
element.descr: TJSONIniFile is a descendant of TCustomIniFile that stores configuration data in JSON format instead of traditional ini file format. The JSON structure uses objects for sections and key-value pairs within those objects for the actual configuration entries. This allows for more flexible data storage while maintaining full compatibility with the standard ini file interface.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.Create
element.short: Creates a new TJSONIniFile instance

descr.p: Create creates a new TJSONIniFile instance. The constructor has two overloaded forms:

ul.li: Create(AFileName, AOptions) - Creates an instance that reads from and writes to the specified file
Create(AStream, AOptions) - Creates an instance that reads from the provided stream

descr.p: If the file specified in AFileName does not exist, a new empty JSON object is created. If the file exists, it is parsed as JSON and loaded into memory.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.Destroy
element.short: Destroys the TJSONIniFile instance
element.descr: Destroy frees all allocated resources and destroys the TJSONIniFile instance. The internal JSON object is freed and the inherited destructor is called.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ConvertIni
element.short: Converts a traditional ini file to JSON format
element.descr: ConvertIni is a class method that converts an existing traditional ini file to JSON format. The method reads all sections and keys from the source ini file and writes them to a new JSON ini file. If StringsOnly is True, all values are stored as strings. If StringsOnly is False, the method attempts to detect the data type and store integers, floats, booleans, and dates in their appropriate JSON types.

element.descr: ReadString reads a string value from the specified section and key. If the key is not found, the Default value is returned. For structured JSON values (objects or arrays), the JSON representation is returned as a string. For other values, the string representation is returned.

element.short: Reads an integer value from the JSON ini file
element.descr: ReadInteger reads an integer value from the specified section and key. If the stored value is a JSON number, it is converted to integer. If the stored value is a string, it attempts to parse it as an integer. If the key is not found or conversion fails, the Default value is returned.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSection
element.short: Reads all key names from a section
element.descr: ReadSection reads all key names from the specified section and adds them to the Strings list. Only keys with actual values (not JSON objects or arrays) are included in the list. If the section does not exist, the list remains unchanged.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSection.Section
element.short: The section name to read keys from

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSection.Strings
element.short: String list to store the key names

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSections
element.short: Reads all section names from the JSON ini file
element.descr: ReadSections reads all section names from the JSON ini file and adds them to the Strings list. Only top-level JSON objects are considered sections.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSections.Strings
element.short: String list to store the section names

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSectionValues
element.short: Reads all key-value pairs from a section
element.descr: ReadSectionValues reads all key-value pairs from the specified section and adds them to the Strings list in the format "key=value". The AOptions parameter controls which types of values are included. If svoIncludeInvalid is in AOptions, structured JSON values (objects and arrays) are included as their JSON representation.

element.short: The section name to read key-value pairs from

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSectionValues.Strings

element.name: TJSONIniFile.ReadSectionValues.AOptions

element.name: TJSONIniFile.EraseSection
element.short: Removes an entire section from the JSON ini file
element.descr: EraseSection removes the specified section and all its key-value pairs from the JSON ini file. If the section does not exist, the method has no effect. The file is automatically updated unless CacheUpdates is True.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.EraseSection.Section
element.short: The section name to remove

element.name: TJSONIniFile.DeleteKey
element.short: Removes a key from a section
element.descr: DeleteKey removes the specified key from the specified section. If the section or key does not exist, the method has no effect. The file is automatically updated unless CacheUpdates is True.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.DeleteKey.Section

element.name: TJSONIniFile.DeleteKey.Ident

element.name: TJSONIniFile.UpdateFile
element.short: Writes the JSON data to file

descr.p: UpdateFile writes the current JSON data to the file. The method has two overloaded forms:

ul.li: UpdateFile() - writes to the file specified in the constructor
UpdateFile(AFileName) - writes to the specified file

descr.p: The JSON data is formatted with proper indentation before writing.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.UpdateFile.AFileName
element.short: The file name to write JSON data to

element.name: TJSONIniFile.Stream
element.short: Read-only access to the internal stream
element.descr: Stream provides read-only access to the internal stream used by the TJSONIniFile instance. This property is only available when the instance was created with a stream parameter. For file-based instances, this property returns nil.

element.name: TJSONIniFile.CacheUpdates
element.short: Controls when changes are written to file
element.descr: CacheUpdates controls when changes to the JSON data are written to the file. When CacheUpdates is True, changes are cached in memory and only written to file when UpdateFile is called explicitly or when CacheUpdates is set to False. When CacheUpdates is False, changes are written to file immediately.
